name: bilingualism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the fact of using or being able to speak two languages: The article examined the many advantages of encouraging bilingualism in children. There are indications that bilingualism may deliver lifelong cognitive benefits.
the fact or official policy of using two languages in a country, region, etc. and giving them equal importance: The 1960s saw the rise of Quebec separatism in Canada, and the promotion of biculturalism and bilingualism.
More examplesFewer examplesThe bilingualism that immigrant children bring to the classroom should be reinforced, not condemned.Street signs and bus and train logos appear in both French and Flemish, but this bilingualism doesn't seem to bring people together.
